title: Mary Earps - Wikipedia
snippet: She and Paris Saint-Germain lost 5–2 on aggregate to Juventus in the 2024–25 UEFA Women's Champions League qualifying rounds. On 12 November 2025, Earps returned to Manchester United in the Champions League for the first time since her move, where they lost 2-1.

title: England Women's player profile: Mary Earps | England Football
snippet: After five years at Old Trafford and helping the club to their first ever Women's FA Cup title in 2024, Mary took on a new challenge by joining French giants Paris Saint-Germain. Earps called time on her spell with the Lionesses in May 2025, after collecting a total of 53 caps.

title: England goalkeeper Mary Earps announces international retirement before Euro 2025 - The Athletic
snippet: Goalkeeper Mary Earps has announced her retirement from international football and will not be part of Sarina Wiegman’s England squad at the 2025 European Championship. Earps was capped 53 times by the national team and was an integral part ...

title: Mary Earps left Manchester United to become a better player at PSG, England goalkeeper tells Pitch to Pod | Football News | Sky Sports
snippet: Pitch to Pod: Nikita Parris and Jordan Nobbs joined by England goalkeeper Mary Earps, who discusses life in France and why she joined PSG, plus all things Lionesses as she opens up on the early years in her career, when a permanent international spot was just a dream...
